entries.english: Gũthĩĩ (to go) → Mũthĩĩ (traveller), Kũruga (to cook) → Mũrugi (cook), Gũciara (to give birth) → Mũciari (parent), Kũrigita (to nurse) → Mũrigiti/Mũrigitani (nurse), Kũrĩma (to farm) → Mũrĩmi (farmer), Kũũmba (to mold with clay) → Mũmbi (potter), Kwenda (to want/love) → Mwendwa (lover), Kũrwara (to be sick) → Mũrwaru (sick person), Kũiya (to steal) → Mũici (thief)
Thibitarĩ (hospital), Mũrwaru (patient), Nđagĩtarĩ (doctor), Mũrigitani (nurse), Dagĩtarĩ wa magego (dentist), Mĩthaiga/Nđawa (medicine), Nđawa ya mbũrũgũtũ (tablet)

Metha (table), Mbica (picture/photo), Nyũngũ (cooking pot), Ngĩrathi (glass), Thaani (plate), Baathi (iron for clothes), Terebiceni (television), Thaburia (saucepan), Mbirika (kettle), Kuburi (padlock), Cabi (keys), Ng'ombe (cow), Thenge (he-goat), Ngũkũ (chicken/hen), Mbata (duck), Ngigĩ (grasshopper)

Kũgũra (to buy), Kũgwa (to fall), Kũhinga (to close), Kũhingũra (to open), Kũhota (to manage/be able to do), Kũiga (to keep/place), Kũmenya (to know), Kũnyita (to catch/hold/understand), Kũrehe (to bring), Kũringa (to hit), Kũrũga (to cook), Kũrũgama (to stand), Kũrũmĩrĩra (to follow), Kuuga (to say), Kwenda (to want/love), Kwendia (to sell), Kwohera (to forgive/tie for someone)
